answers.answer:
New arrivals in Sibiu can access general assistance through a support program for accommodation, meals, and integration, along with information on public transport, medical services, and job support. They can also find contacts for the Sibiu County Immigration Office and explore various organizations offering aid.

To find detailed information, refer to the specific sections within the provided summary, such as 'The support program for accommodation, meals and integration in Sibiu', 'Public transport in Sibiu', 'Medical services', and 'Jobs Support'. For broader assistance and contacts, you can also visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-sibiu mentioned at the end of the summary.

answers.answer:
Important contact numbers include the Sibiu County Immigration Office (0269 208 482, 0269 208 553), Emergency (112), National Anti-Traffic Hotline (0800 800 678 / 021 313 3100), and Sus Inima (+40 751 138 783).

To find detailed information, visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-sibiu and look under the "Important contacts" section for general numbers, and explore other sections like "Medical services," "Psychological support," and "Organisations offering their support" for specific services.

To find detailed information, visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-sibiu and look under the "Important contacts" section for general numbers, and explore other sections like "Medical services," "Psychological support," and "Organisations offering their support" for specific services. Yes, psychological support services are available in Sibiu. The A.L.E.G. Association and the International Rescue Committee offer such services to various groups, including Ukrainian refugees and the local population.

You can find detailed information on the webpage under the 'Psychological support' section, or by visiting the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-sibiu and navigating to the Sibiu section.

Organizations offering support services in Sibiu include the Sibiu County Immigration Office, A.L.E.G. Association, The International Rescue Committee, Sus Inima, the Women's Center, and Sens Pozitiv. The County Emergency Clinical Hospital Sibiu also provides medical services.

To find detailed information, refer to the relevant sections in the summary, such as 'Psychological support' or 'Organisations offering their support', where contact details and further links are provided for each organization.

answers.answer:
Sus Inima provides free basic food and hygiene products, access to therapies and medical services, Romanian and English language courses, temporary accommodation for refugees, a day center for Ukrainian children, and educational infrastructure for Ukrainian children.

To find detailed information, navigate to the "Organisations offering their support" section on the webpage and look for the entry related to "Sus Inima."

Yes, people living with HIV in Romania can receive free, anonymous, and confidential psycho-medical-social HIV services from specialist doctors at 10 Regional HIV Centers and through Sens Pozitiv.

To find detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-sibiu and look under the section titled "Counseling for people living with HIV."
